Class Neuron

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn.Neuron
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActivationsCachedNeuron, AssociationUnit, InputNeuron, LastInputStoredNeuron
@DomainObject @Entity public class Neuron extends Object
Represents a single artificial neuron in a neural network.

A Neuron receives inputs from other neurons, combines them using a weighted sum plus a bias, and passes the result (the "logit") through an ActivationFunction to produce its output.

Computation

For a neuron with inputs x₁ … xₙ, weights w₁ … wₙ, and bias b, the forward activation is: 
   logit = b + Σ (wᵢ * xᵢ)
   output = activationFunction.activate(logit)

Lifecycle

  • Before activation, the neuron has no valid logit or output.
  • activate() computes the neuron’s output, caching the logit and activation result and marking it as "activated".
  • deactivate() resets the activation flag, allowing the neuron to be re-evaluated (e.g., for another forward pass).
  • getLogit() and getOutput() may only be called after activation.

Thread safety

  • Activation and deactivation are synchronized to prevent race conditions in concurrent evaluation.
  • Weight and bias setters are not synchronized; concurrent modification must be managed externally if required.

    Linear combination of inputs before activation.

    • Neuron

      public Neuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputs, ActivationFunction activationFunction)
      Constructs a new neuron with the given name, inputs, and activation function.
      Parameters:
      name - human-readable identifier
      inputs - input neurons (empty if none)
      activationFunction - function to apply to the weighted sum

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      the human-readable identifier of this neuron

    • getInputs

      public List<? extends Neuron> getInputs()
      Returns:
      the input neurons feeding into this neuron

    • getActivationFunction

      public ActivationFunction getActivationFunction()
      Returns:
      the activation function applied to the weighted sum

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Computes the logit and output of this neuron by aggregating inputs, applying weights and bias, and passing the result through the activation function. Subsequent calls are ignored until deactivate() is invoked.

    • isActivated

      public boolean isActivated()
      Returns:
      whether this neuron has been activated

    • deactivate

      public void deactivate()
      Resets the activated flag so the neuron can be re-evaluated.

    • getWeights

      public float[] getWeights()
      Returns:
      the trainable weights of this neuron

      public void setBias(float bias)
      Sets the trainable bias of this neuron.

    • getLogit

      public float getLogit()
      Returns the pre-activation weighted sum of inputs.
      Returns:
      the computed logit
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the neuron has not been activated

    • getOutput

      public float getOutput()
      Returns the post-activation output of this neuron.
      Returns:
      the activated output value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the neuron has not been activated

    • findWeight

      public Float findWeight(Neuron source)
      Finds the weight associated with a given source neuron.
      Parameters:
      source - the input neuron
      Returns:
      the corresponding weight, or null if not found
